New_Rochelle.Boston Post Road Historic District (Rye,: The Boston Post Road Historic District is a 286 acre National Historic Landmark District that is composed of 5 distinct and adjacent properties. Within this landmarked area are three pre-Civil War mansions and their grounds, a 10,000-year-old Paleo-Indian site and viewshed, a private cemetery, and a nature preserve. It is 1 of only 11 National Historic Landmark Districts in New York State and the only National Historic Landmark District in Westchester County.
